overview_of_class: This course is a broad survey of several of the main concepts in modern astrophysics. Topics to be covered include the basics of stars; the evolution of stars on the main sequence; stellar death and stellar remnants (white dwarfs, neutron stars and black holes); star formation; and the Milky Way and other galaxies. Time permitting, we will also cover the basics of cosmology. The course develops these astronomical concepts starting from undergraduate-level physics.
